purpleculture_pinyin:
zhèn
legendary bird whose feathers can be used as poison; poisonous; to poison sb
легендарная птица, перья которой можно использовать как яд; ядовитый; отравить кого-то
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 鴆)
Pictophonetic: 冘 indicates the sound; 鸟 (bird) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
饮鸩止渴 [ yǐn zhèn zhǐ kě ]: lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom); fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
鸩羽 [ zhèn yǔ ]: the poisonous feathers of the legendary bird Zhen 鸩

• ⿰ Left to right
    • 冘 [ yín ] to move on; doubtful
    • 鸟 [ niǎo ] bird

鸩字的基本解释

鸩
（鴆）
zhèn
传说中的一种毒鸟。把它的羽毛放在酒里，可以毒杀人。
用鸩的羽毛泡成的毒酒：鸩酒。饮鸩止渴。
用毒酒害人。

鸩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhèn］
［《廣韻》直禁切，去沁，澄。］
“酖2”的被通假字。“鸩1”的繁体字。
(1)传说中的一种毒鸟。以羽浸酒，饮之立死。
(2)传说中的食蜚（幼蝗）的鸟。
(3)指鸩鸟的毒羽。
(4)鸩羽浸制的毒酒。
(5)以鸩酒杀人。
(6)毒害。

鸩字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【鳥字部】　鴆； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1505第14
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?直禁切，音沈。【說文】毒鳥也。【玉篇】毒鳥食蛇，其羽畫酒，飮之卽死。【廣雅】鴆鳥。其雄謂之運日，其雌謂之隂諧。【廣志】鴆形似鷹，大如鶚，毛黑，喙長，食蛇及橡實。【晉語】置鴆於酒。【屈原·離騷】吾令鴆爲媒兮，鴆告予以不好。又鴆有同名殊類者。【山海經】瑤碧之山有鳥，狀如雉，恆食蜚，名曰鴆。又通作酖。【左傳·閔元年】宴安酖毒，不可懷也。【註】酖與鴆通。又【集韻】徒南切，音覃。義同。又丁紺切，音馾。鳥名。或作??。

鸩字的源字形

小篆楷体

暂无。

poison
Basic explanation of words
poison
(poison)
zhèn
A kind of poisonous bird in the legend. Putting its feathers in wine can poison and kill people.
Poisoned wine made from the feathers of poison: poisonous wine. Drink poison to quench thirst.
Use poison to harm people.
poison
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhèn］
["Guangyun" directly forbids cutting, goes to Qin, Cheng. ]
The false word for "鸩2". "鸩1" in traditional characters.
(1) A kind of poisonous bird in the legend. Soak the wine with feathers, drink it and die.
(2) The legendary bird that eats worms (young locusts).
(3) Refers to the poisonous feathers of thrush.
(4) Toxic liquor soaked in the feather feathers.
(5) Killing people with bad wine.
(6) Poisoning.
poison
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Bird Character Department] 　鸩; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1505 No. 14
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Direct cut, deep tone. [Said the text] Poisonous birds too. [Jade articles] Poisonous birds eat snakes, their feathers are painted with wine, and they die. [Guang Ya] The bird. The male is the day of luck, and the female is the humorous. [Guangzhi] The shark resembles an eagle and is as big as an osprey, with black hair, a long beak, snake-eating and acorn. [Jin dialect] Put the bad guys in the wine. [Qu Yuan·Lisao] I ordered the poison to be a matchmaker, but it is not good to report to it. There are also different kinds of people with the same name. [Shanhaijing] The Yaobi mountain has birds, resembling pheasants, constantly feeding on worms, and the name is roar. Also pass as a poison. [Zuo Zhuan·The first year of Min] Banquet for poisonous poison, don't cherish it. [Note] Poison and Poison communicate. Also [Jiyun] Tu Nanqie, Yintan. The same meaning. Ding Cang cut again, the sound of music. The name of the bird. Or as ??.

poison
Name meaning
Nothing.
zhèn
I сущ.
1) миф. чжэнь-няо, птица с ядовитыми перьями, ядовитая выпь (величиною с орла, тёмно-красного цвета, с красным клювом, питается змеями)
2) перья ядовитой выпи, ядовитые перья; яд, отрава; ядовитый, отравленный
置鸩于酒 положить ядовитые перья в вино, отравить вино
3) отравленное ядовитыми перьями вино
饮鸩而死 выпить отравленного вина и умереть
II гл.
отравлять отравленным вином
使医鸩之 велеть лекарю отравить его ядовитым вином
